hotspots.label: Eye and Head
hotspots.fact: Lizards have excellent eyesight to help them survive in their environment! Their large, round eyes can see movement very well, which helps them spot insects to eat and watch out for danger. This is called **adaptation** — a special body part or behavior that helps an animal live in its habitat.

vocabulary.definition: A special feature or behavior that helps an animal survive and live successfully in its environment.

hotspots.label: Legs and Feet
hotspots.fact: This lizard has strong legs with special toes that help it climb and grip plants and branches! Each toe has tiny claws that work like sticky pads, allowing the lizard to hold on and move around easily. These body structures help the lizard find food and escape from predators.

vocabulary.definition: A specific body part of a living thing that has a special job to help it survive.

hotspots.label: Skin and Coloring
hotspots.fact: The lizard's brown and white coloring helps it hide in plants and trees — this is called **camouflage**! When the lizard blends in with its surroundings, predators have a harder time seeing it. The lizard's scaly skin also helps protect its body and keeps it from drying out.

vocabulary.definition: Colors or patterns on an animal's body that help it blend in and hide from other animals.

hotspots.label: Tail
hotspots.fact: A lizard's long tail helps it balance while climbing and moving quickly on plants! If a predator catches the lizard's tail, the tail can break off and keep moving to distract the predator while the lizard escapes. This amazing ability is called **regeneration** — the ability to grow a new tail over time.

vocabulary.definition: The ability of a living thing to grow back a body part that has been lost or damaged.
